DialogueDictionary.Day 42: The resources we have obtained f: Day 42: The resources we have obtained from this system's terrestrial planet are helpful, especially the fish we have found in one of the ponds.
Day 42: The resources we have obtained from this system's terrestrial planet are helpful, especially the fish we have found in one of the ponds. We'll never run out of food now!
DialogueDictionary.Day 43: I scanned the fish with my visio: Day 43: I scanned the fish with my vision torch. It says these fish will evolve into an intelligent species, and that one individual will be able to make it here. Interesting...
DialogueDictionary.Our conservatory should be just enough t: Our conservatory should be just enough to produce healthy seeds for the next 5 years. That is more than enough time that we need to finish the terraforming.
DialogueDictionary.Next you shall let the water flow, only: Next you shall let the water flow, only then will our trees regrow. Obtain the water above the sky, from the Ringed Giant way up high.
DialogueDictionary.Day 66: I have finished setting up this: Day 66: I have finished setting up this simulation for myself and anyone who stumbles across it, with the purpose of preserving the fifth planet before its destruction. All slide reels have also been uploaded and preserved within it, but I will make sure it is never used the way my kind has done.
DialogueDictionary.Fourth, keep out a watchful eye. Make su: Fourth, keep out a watchful eye. Make sure our offspring does not die.
DialogueDictionary.Day 90: We successfully grew a Bramble S: Day 90: We successfully grew a Bramble Seed on the south pole of this moon, but the atmosphere had some strange effect within the seed itself. We will enter the hurricane with our ship and enter through the top node, so our ship can fit.
DialogueDictionary.These are Anglerfish, an omnivorous spec: These are Anglerfish, an omnivorous species of deep sea fish that can handle extreme environments. They naturally appear in deep parts of the fifth planet's subsurface ocean. They also end up in Bramble Seed pocket dimensions, because the invasive plant started growing at the bottom of the ocean.
DialogueDictionary.The fifth planet currently has an invasi: The fifth planet currently has an invasive plant that started rapidly growing from the bottom of its subsurface ocean, and today has grown almost to the surface. To the left is what the fifth planet of this system looks like, to the right is what the planet and its fate will look like in the future.
DialogueDictionary.Apparently, it has been discovered that: Apparently, it has been discovered that the only way to stop the growth of the plant is through use of the minerals found all over this moon. However, it can have side effects to the pocket dimensions it connects to, eliminating all light within. The anglerfish also seem to act different.
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 1: Getting a closer look at: OBSERVATION 1: Getting a closer look at all the planets, there's water on every planet, the third having it in the form of snow on its surface. The desert twins have water and sand flowing between them like an hourglass, but it won't be too long until the water on the sand-like planet starts to evaporate.
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 2: A ghostly moon with a sim: OBSERVATION 2: A ghostly moon with a similar atmosphere as this moon changes its orbit according to each planet. It leaves view sometimes to reach a sixth location, possibly the vortex. Could both the cloaked and ghostly moons be evil twins of one another?
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 3: I just pointed my telesco: OBSERVATION 3: I just pointed my telescope at the fifth planet...what I saw...I was shocked. My plans might work after all! This is going to the archives right away!
DialogueDictionary.Day 1: My family and I just crash landed: Day 1: My family and I just crash landed here, and we have no idea where we are. The atmosphere here is thick and the temperatures are bearable, so I think we can survive here for a while with our emergency tree kit.
DialogueDictionary.Day 5: I remember this place! This is th: Day 5: I remember this place! This is the place our kind mined the materials for the cloaking device! Since the minerals power themselves, I can use it to fuel my ship and get resources from this system's terrestrial planet.
DialogueDictionary.Terraforming is difficult, but not impos: Terraforming is difficult, but not impossible. All we need is trees for oxygen, water for life, and some means of getting there. Imagine the pain if our universe was a trillion times bigger.
DialogueDictionary.I can't use my kind's ship, so we need a: I can't use my kind's ship, so we need another means of transport and we need to grow more trees. We can get the water by extracting the hydrogen and oxygen from the Teal-Ringed Giant.
DialogueDictionary.Day 40: Finally, everything is built. No: Day 40: Finally, everything is built. Now to continue my research...
DialogueDictionary.Day 50: I finally got ahold of my kind's: Day 50: I finally got ahold of my kind's ship with my signal station. I will be leaving tomorrow to finally get this plan back on track.
DialogueDictionary.Day 64: Unfortunately, I had to leave ou: Day 64: Unfortunately, I had to leave our ship. The others have gone insane, and refuse to leave this new simulation they built. There's nothing I can do to help them.
DialogueDictionary.For our old world to be revived, get the: For our old world to be revived, get these things and it shall thrive. There is an order it shall follow, or it will stay dead and hollow. First things first, go get a seed. Then search elsewhere for the rest you need.
DialogueDictionary.This hidden moon is orbiting around the: This hidden moon is orbiting around the fifth planet of this star system. Its origins are odd for something that should have come from its parent planet.
DialogueDictionary.The planet is abundant with a smooth, bl: The planet is abundant with a smooth, black mineral with strange properties. Our kind used these resources for our ship.
DialogueDictionary.This is the north pole, where most of th: This is the north pole, where most of the base lies. The south pole is dangerous and has extremely strange properties, but it's not impossible to enter.
DialogueDictionary.Day 70: When I was calculating trajector: Day 70: When I was calculating trajectories for this moon's orbit, it's also a moon for the object that drove my kind insane. I hardly remember the details of it, but I can assume that this moon collided with it.
DialogueDictionary.Day 45: An anomaly has occured with the: Day 45: An anomaly has occured with the signal blocker, as I was able to detect The Eye's signal. However, this anomaly allowed me to track the connection wavelengths between our ship and the blocker, now that I have it located.
DialogueDictionary.Input these poems as a secret code, but: Input these poems as a secret code, but put a star in the fifth node.
DialogueDictionary.The light bulb above the hidden door in: The light bulb above the hidden door in the Bramble Museum has somehow synced with the door under it, which can be found with a flashlight. The closer it is to opening, the darker the light bulb gets.
DialogueDictionary.With those two things, fresh air will fl: With those two things, fresh air will flourish, so plants and animals can thrive and nourish.
DialogueDictionary.The seeds grow best on sunny days, our a: The seeds grow best on sunny days, our air lets fires set ablaze.
DialogueDictionary.There was an old story about an electric: There was an old story about an electric hurricane on the Scientist's base planet. I bet it has similar properties to the hazardous water around this vortex. I'm sure I've also heard that you can set it down and walk away from it a decent amount of meters away.
DialogueDictionary.The Defense Ministry has ordered us to e: The Defense Ministry has ordered us to extract the electric fluid for their weapons. Why do we even need weapons? Are we really in danger?
DialogueDictionary.Perhaps we are, and they're keeping it c: Perhaps we are, and they're keeping it classified to keep us under control. Maybe it's best we follow their orders, to protect our homeworld.
DialogueDictionary.NOTE: To find the white ship, use the ge: NOTE: To find the white ship, use the gear interface to activate a signal and follow it.
DialogueDictionary.The enemy behind the anomaly has finally: The enemy behind the anomaly has finally shown its face! A massive white ship capable of warp technology has warped to our system.
DialogueDictionary.On further examination, the ship has no: On further examination, the ship has no weapons. The war is in our favor!
DialogueDictionary.If Operation Phoenix succeeds, we must p: If Operation Phoenix succeeds, we must put a cloak on the ship so that no one finds it. Is that clear?
DialogueDictionary.We still have quite a long while until o: We still have quite a long while until our star dies, maybe another 281,083 years. But when it does, the desert planet will lose its atmosphere when the clock hits star.
DialogueDictionary.NOTICE: The seal will be burned when the: NOTICE: The seal will be burned when the lava's tide rises. Luckily, this won't happen until ring time around the last minutes before our star dies in case we need it again.
DialogueDictionary.This clock here lasts for 44 minutes, wi: This clock here lasts for 44 minutes, with each 11 minutes being a symbol.
DialogueDictionary.We have detected an alien anomaly in the: We have detected an alien anomaly in the now overgrown ice planet, likely inside its dimensions. We must prepare in case some horrifying beast tries to pose a threat to our homeworld. We must not lose it again!
DialogueDictionary.In order to respond to anomalies like th: In order to respond to anomalies like the one that just happened, today I announce the founding of the Ministry of Defense!
DialogueDictionary.All of our nuclear arsenal is ready for: All of our nuclear arsenal is ready for defense! We are prepared for Operation Phoenix.
DialogueDictionary.Day 100: The mineral's side effects not: Day 100: The mineral's side effects not only turn the dimension's fog black, but also give the anglerfish an interesting property. Turns out, they change location each time you look away.
DialogueDictionary.Day 99: Just started to map out these po: Day 99: Just started to map out these pocket dimension. Thankfully I scanned the lighted node with my vision torch, because there's no way out! That dimension is a trap!
DialogueDictionary.Day 105: I did it! After days of searchi: Day 105: I did it! After days of searching, I've found the right path to what might be our home system! I'll make a slide recording in case I don't forget.
DialogueDictionary.Alright, this is it...the End of the Uni: Alright, this is it...the End of the Universe. I hope my distant uncle was right about this place giving birth to a new universe in our place.
DialogueDictionary.If it wasn't for your distant uncle, we: If it wasn't for your distant uncle, we wouldn't be here.
DialogueDictionary.How did you get here so fast?: How did you get here so fast?
DialogueDictionary.Letting go that signal was a very risky: Letting go that signal was a very risky move, someone would have ended the universe too early. Instead, it gave you the tools to reach The Vortex.
DialogueDictionary.I don't know, maybe I'm just faster than: I don't know, maybe I'm just faster than you.
DialogueDictionary.Since I went ahead of you before, I'll j: Since I went ahead of you before, I'll just let you plunge in first.
DialogueDictionary.Alright, see you on the other side!: Alright, see you on the other side!
DialogueDictionary.It's.....beautiful...No wonder our kind: It's.....beautiful...No wonder our kind destroyed our homeworld to get to it...
DialogueDictionary.Yeah, there's no word that can perfectly: Yeah, there's no word that can perfectly describe it.
DialogueDictionary.Right on! Let's head down there, shall w: Right on! Let's head down there, shall we?
DialogueDictionary....Eh? That's it? Were you here before o: ...Eh? That's it? Were you here before or something?
DialogueDictionary.No but I expected better. Let's just hea: No but I expected better. Let's just head on down.
DialogueDictionary.Oh hey Hatchling! I thought I lost you f: Oh hey Hatchling! I thought I lost you for good! Weirdly enough, I see my friend Bark from the Distant Enigma shivering over there.
DialogueDictionary.No, that's my friend Esker from our home: No, that's my friend Esker from our home planet's moon.
DialogueDictionary.So it seems like you only see your frien: So it seems like you only see your friends and I only see mine.
DialogueDictionary.Perhaps The Eye is saving resources, and: Perhaps The Eye is saving resources, and we each see it from a different perspective.
DialogueDictionary.Good theory. You must be quite the explo: Good theory. You must be quite the explorer!
DialogueDictionary.Couldn't have done it without that time: Couldn't have done it without that time loop!
DialogueDictionary.Time loop? Maybe you're not joking after: Time loop? Maybe you're not joking after all...
DialogueDictionary.Believe what you want to believe, Cypres: Believe what you want to believe, Cypress. I've got work to do here.
DialogueDictionary.What a beautiful song. You should probab: What a beautiful song. You should probably check out that bubble, I'll stay here and watch.
DialogueDictionary.Hello, Hatchling. This area is nothing l: Hello, Hatchling. This area is nothing like I've seen before.
DialogueDictionary.Something tells me that there's more to: Something tells me that there's more to explore here, so go on and investigate!
DialogueDictionary.OK, I'll go gather the rest!: OK, I'll go gather the rest!
DialogueDictionary.I may have lost my friends, my children,: I may have lost my friends, my children, and sometimes even my sanity, but despite that, I pushed forward and I made my dreams come true.
DialogueDictionary.From what my brother has learned about T: From what my brother has learned about The Eye, it is a tool of sacrifice. He knew that our kind was doomed once we boarded The Stranger, so he thought it was time.
DialogueDictionary.Little did he know, the universe is bigg: Little did he know, the universe is bigger and contains more intelligent life than he thought, so it would be unfair to end their lives too.
DialogueDictionary.But you? You activated The Eye at the pe: But you? You activated The Eye at the perfect time. The Universe was already dying, and it was calling for you to end its misery and fill its remains with new life.
DialogueDictionary.I hope you can forgive my ancestors and: I hope you can forgive my ancestors and I for blocking the signal, eating your primitive ancestors to survive, and killing a whole clan of Nomai.
DialogueDictionary.What few members of my kind know is that: What few members of my kind know is that everyone has their flaws, including myself. Instead of attacking them for offending you or impeding on your values, put those feelings aside and focus on unity and brotherhood.
DialogueDictionary.So thank you Hatchling, thank you for ad: So thank you Hatchling, thank you for admiring my work. Now let's get ready to set this new universe in stone!
DialogueDictionary.Very well said! Let's continue to press: Very well said! Let's continue to press forward!
DialogueDictionary.Right on, Hatchling! Us explorers must a: Right on, Hatchling! Us explorers must always stick together!
DialogueDictionary.I think this is it, the new universe. Go: I think this is it, the new universe. Go on ahead and figure out a way to actviate it!
DialogueDictionary.This mineral is found on Angler's Eye, a: This mineral is found on Angler's Eye, and it's known for its resistance to electricity, its natural cloaking, and ability to stop the Bramble from growing.
DialogueDictionary.The Stranger's Inhabitants used this to: The Stranger's Inhabitants used this to cloak The Stranger, and one individual used it to reach their home moon.
DialogueDictionary.Turns out, Angler's Eye originated from: Turns out, Angler's Eye originated from the Eye of the Universe, and the minerals are weakened quantum shards. Who knew the Quantum Moon had an evil twin?
DialogueDictionary.The Stranger's Inhabitants once lived on: The Stranger's Inhabitants once lived on a lush, green moon, which they destroyed to reach The Eye.
DialogueDictionary.Luckily, one individual stepped up and b: Luckily, one individual stepped up and brought their dormant home back to life, and even repopulated the species!
DialogueDictionary.Hundreds of thousands of years later, th: Hundreds of thousands of years later, they still live in harmony in a stagnant paradise, while doing everything to make sure they don't lose their home again.
DialogueDictionary.After destroying a Nomai Vessel and its: After destroying a Nomai Vessel and its clan, other Nomai clans reacted by putting a no-warp zone around our solar neighborhood.
DialogueDictionary.I even convinced Cypress, the current le: I even convinced Cypress, the current leader of the Strangers' Homeworld, to come with me to The Eye!
DialogueDictionary.Our Scientist brought this mineral with: Our Scientist brought this mineral with him on his trip back from that cloaked moon. Please do not touch!
DialogueDictionary.These are the planets of our star system: These are the planets of our star system! First we have the hot, desert planet, then comes our beloved Ringed Giant where our home moon resides.
DialogueDictionary.Beyond our homeworld lies a stormy, crim: Beyond our homeworld lies a stormy, crimson giant with a violent, volcanic moon. Even further out, is a planet like no other, one with a strange orbit and a transforming surface.
DialogueDictionary.These are Anglerfish, an omnivorous spec: These are Anglerfish, an omnivorous species of deep sea fish that can handle extreme environments. They posed a threat to our Scientist on the way here, but his determination pushed him forward.
DialogueDictionary.Our glorious Scientist crash landed on a: Our glorious Scientist crash landed on a moon orbiting this planet in our nearest neighbor system, plotting to terraform our home. On the left was what it looked like when he was there studying, on the right is what it looks like now. Truly a terrible fate for a planet.
DialogueDictionary.The brilliant ideas of our almighty Scie: The brilliant ideas of our almighty Scientist brought him to the realization of the planet's minerals and their capability to stop the Bramble from growing. He then used the Bramble to warp him home to begin terraforming. As you can see, it was a success!
DialogueDictionary.The Scientist's brother was fascinated w: The Scientist's brother was fascinated with the vortex, so he scanned it again with the vision torch, seeing it would bring a new universe after destroying ours. Driving himself insane, seeing others suffer, he felt it was time to activate the vortex.
DialogueDictionary.He feared leaving in one of our smaller: He feared leaving in one of our smaller ships after what happened to our Scientist, so he stopped the Signal Blocker. It then lead to his eternal imprisonment. All of this put so much emotinal weight on our Scientist.
DialogueDictionary.May he be remembered, not for what he di: May he be remembered, not for what he did, but for the tragedy that drove him to madness.
DialogueDictionary.Here lies the Scientist, in all his form: Here lies the Scientist, in all his former glory. May he forever be remembered for his successful terraforming of our home planet. His final words, "Keep our home safe, by any means necessary".
DialogueDictionary.In memory to all those who suffered and: In memory to all those who suffered and died aboard our ship, meant to reach the vortex. The horrors of famine, self-harm, insanity, and simulated isolation almost wiped out our entire species.
DialogueDictionary.Did you know the universe is dying?: Did you know the universe is dying?
DialogueDictionary.All of our planets. Symptoms of star dea: All of our planets. Symptoms of star death are all over the place. Should blow up in 33 minutes.
DialogueDictionary.And you're doing nothing about it?: And you're doing nothing about it?
DialogueDictionary.Indeed I do, I'm witnessing it before my: Indeed I do, I'm witnessing it before my very eyes.
DialogueDictionary.Yeah, what can we do about it? Besides,: Yeah, what can we do about it? Besides, I'd rather die doing something I love.
DialogueDictionary.What's that joke you were telling the ot: What's that joke you were telling the other one? Can I hear it?
DialogueDictionary.A joke? What's that supposed to mean?: A joke? What's that supposed to mean?
DialogueDictionary.I just meant like, you know, you could t: I just meant like, you know, you could tell me the joke you two were laughing about!
DialogueDictionary.Listen, blue-skin. The only joke here is: Listen, blue-skin. The only joke here is whatever backwater planet you puttered over here from. Is it customary there to interrupt important conversations to demand amusement?
DialogueDictionary.Is all of your kind petulant, sleeve-tug: Is all of your kind petulant, sleeve-tugging children? Because it's seeming like it, pal. Not a good look.
DialogueDictionary.You know, you're not on your grimy, gauc: You know, you're not on your grimy, gauche, gurkin-green grassworld dumpster fire anymore. You're in the galaxy at large now.
DialogueDictionary.I think there's been a mis—: I think there's been a mis—
DialogueDictionary.You might've been a big fish in your lit: You might've been a big fish in your little muck pit—a real hot shot—but now you've gotta come to terms with being the small fry you are. Hike up those rags you call pants and learn some manners.
DialogueDictionary.Yeah, I bet you are. Now I've got a conv: Yeah, I bet you are. Now I've got a conversation to finish. Buzz off.
DialogueDictionary.Hahaha! You're a comedic genius! Tell me: Hahaha! You're a comedic genius! Tell me another!
DialogueDictionary.Can't you see we're in the middle of a c: Can't you see we're in the middle of a conversation?
DialogueDictionary.You've got some guts little one. You're: You've got some guts little one. You're an alien AND you fear my laugh? What have we done to you?
DialogueDictionary.Simulated versions of your ancestors on: Simulated versions of your ancestors on The Stranger kept trying to kill me.
DialogueDictionary.That's no surprise, they drove themselve: That's no surprise, they drove themselves insane. We're not like that anymore, so you're the creep now!
DialogueDictionary.This ship looks similar to the one at th: This ship looks similar to the one at the edge of our star system, but much cleaner. They came to your home system, too?
DialogueDictionary.Yes, they were looking for the Eye of th: Yes, they were looking for the Eye of the Universe, and now we're about to go there ourselves.
DialogueDictionary.Alright then, let's stop holding back an: Alright then, let's stop holding back and do this!
...Cool...I just am not a talker, sorry...
DialogueDictionary.I...I.....Don't ask me difficult questio: I...I.....Don't ask me difficult questions! Just leave me alone!
DialogueDictionary.Is it just me or is there a bug on the s: Is it just me or is there a bug on the stairs?
DialogueDictionary.Aww, I wanted to kill it!: Aww, I wanted to kill it!
DialogueDictionary.For that, I hope you trip and fall on yo: For that, I hope you trip and fall on your way out.
DialogueDictionary.Don't bother me while I'm performing!: Don't bother me while I'm performing!
DialogueDictionary.I got my eye on you, alien. You'll be so: I got my eye on you, alien. You'll be sorry if you do anything wrong here.
DialogueDictionary.What are some good places to explore on: What are some good places to explore on this planet?
DialogueDictionary.Unfortunately, my job is to guard and co: Unfortunately, my job is to guard and conserve the planet and our species, and my gut thinks you'll pose a threat to it.
I'll try not to get into any trouble.
DialogueDictionary.Well, you can start at our Observation D: Well, you can start at our Observation Deck somewhere on this side of the plateau, and from there you should explore the other planets. I'd feel much more comfortable with you exploring those places instead.
DialogueDictionary.You're welcome, but I still have my eye: You're welcome, but I still have my eye on you!
DialogueDictionary.Oh heya! You must be that alien our Scie: Oh heya! You must be that alien our Scientist foresaw during his terraform studies. Welcome!
DialogueDictionary.So far, you're the only one who's ever w: So far, you're the only one who's ever welcomed me.
DialogueDictionary.Yeah, I'm the only one here that's not a: Yeah, I'm the only one here that's not afraid of aliens.
DialogueDictionary.You can call me \"Hatchling\". Nice meet: You can call me "Hatchling". Nice meeting you!
DialogueDictionary.Why is your kind so xenophobic?: Why is your kind so xenophobic?
DialogueDictionary.If ya want a li'l history lesson, there': If ya want a li'l history lesson, there's a museum and memorial dedicated to the Scientist on the South Pole. I'm sure you've seen plenty of his studies though!
DialogueDictionary.Nice to meet ya, my name is Blossom. I'm: Nice to meet ya, my name is Blossom. I'm one of the few of my kind that's not afraid of aliens.
DialogueDictionary.It's a pleasure meeting you too!: It's a pleasure meeting you too!
DialogueDictionary.I think it started hundreds of thousands: I think it started hundreds of thousands of years ago when our space program mysteriously disappeared.
DialogueDictionary.Apart from that, I don't really know. Al: Apart from that, I don't really know. All traces of that history are gone, or at least forgotten. Even our historians couldn't figure it out!
DialogueDictionary.However, members of the new space progra: However, members of the new space program have claimed to have seen strange iron bases on most of the other planets. Maybe it's worth a gander?
DialogueDictionary.All in all, I think we're all just scare: All in all, I think we're all just scared of losing our home again, but we were the ones that took it away in the first place.
DialogueDictionary....Who are you? Where did you come from?: ...Who are you? Where did you come from?
DialogueDictionary.I am a Hearthian. I come in peace from t: I am a Hearthian. I come in peace from the next system over.
DialogueDictionary.Doesn't matter. Come with me. Your life: Doesn't matter. Come with me. Your life depends on it!
DialogueDictionary.Yeah right! How am I supposed to trust y: Yeah right! How am I supposed to trust you? Stop wasting my time!
DialogueDictionary.No buts! Go back to your homeland, and d: No buts! Go back to your homeland, and don't mess with us!
DialogueDictionary.Like I'd tell an alien my personal infor: Like I'd tell an alien my personal information! That's just asking for death!
DialogueDictionary.You're on our home turf, and we're not g: You're on our home turf, and we're not going to risk you ruining our utopia!
DialogueDictionary.Why should I trust you? Are you going to: Why should I trust you? Are you going to kidnap me?
DialogueDictionary.The universe is dying, we have no choice: The universe is dying, we have no choice but to activate The Eye!
DialogueDictionary.The Eye? That vortex thing? I'd rather d: The Eye? That vortex thing? I'd rather die here on my homeworld!
DialogueDictionary.If The Scientist was here, he'd say it's: If The Scientist was here, he'd say it's time.
DialogueDictionary.I remember...he passed down a note throu: I remember...he passed down a note through many generations.
DialogueDictionary.It said...\"Wait for all the stars to di: It said..."Wait for all the stars to die, then activate the Universe's Eye".
DialogueDictionary.Heh, you know a lot, stranger! Do you ha: Heh, you know a lot, stranger! Do you have something to take us there?
DialogueDictionary.Alright, I alone shall come with you on: Alright, I alone shall come with you on this journey.
DialogueDictionary.The others can keep guard of our homelan: The others can keep guard of our homeland. I'll start my way on over.
DialogueDictionary....So you came all this way after discov: ...So you came all this way after discovering my ancestor's terraforming studies? Just like he predicted...
Yeah I'm going to go exploring now.
DialogueDictionary.Come with me. Your life depends on it!: Come with me. Your life depends on it!
DialogueDictionary.Enjoy your stay, just don't do anything: Enjoy your stay, just don't do anything to our utopia or else we'll exile you from the system!
DialogueDictionary.Sorry, now that I know you're the fabled: Sorry, now that I know you're the fabled alien to find his work, I'll introduce myself.
DialogueDictionary.My name is Cypress, I'm The Scientist's: My name is Cypress, I'm The Scientist's very distant grandson and the current leader of this place.
DialogueDictionary.Nice to meet you! They call me \"Hatchli: Nice to meet you! They call me "Hatchling".
DialogueDictionary.Greetings Hatchling. I hope you enjoy yo: Greetings Hatchling. I hope you enjoy your time here at our utopia.
DialogueDictionary.Why must I go with you, Hatchling? Is it: Why must I go with you, Hatchling? Is it really that urgent?
DialogueDictionary.Did you know your star is going to die?: Did you know your star is going to die?
DialogueDictionary.Where can I explore in this star system?: Where can I explore in this star system?
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Hornfels, one: You remind me of my friend Hornfels, one of the heads of our space program.
DialogueDictionary.I am Twig, head of our space program. On: I am Twig, head of our space program. One we just re-founded a year or so ago.
DialogueDictionary.Hundreds and thousands of years ago, we: Hundreds and thousands of years ago, we used to have an active presence in space a few generations after our Scientist re-terraformed everything.
DialogueDictionary.But that was all so long ago, and everyt: But that was all so long ago, and everything of the old program was lost, forgotten, or abandoned.
DialogueDictionary.None of us know the reason why they stop: None of us know the reason why they stopped the program, not even our historians. All we know is that the program didn't even last a year.
DialogueDictionary.Now, we're just carefree explorers, most: Now, we're just carefree explorers, most of us use these other planets as vacation resorts, as treacherous as they may be.
DialogueDictionary.I doubt we can solve the mystery of our: I doubt we can solve the mystery of our ancestors in a matter of minutes, though.
DialogueDictionary.Well I sure can! I'm in a time loop!: Well I sure can! I'm in a time loop!
DialogueDictionary.A time loop? Did you accidentally inhale: A time loop? Did you accidentally inhale the fumes of a Vision Torch or something?
DialogueDictionary.Archiving our data since our star is dyi: Archiving our data since our star is dying. Hopefully we can send it out past the supernova and hope someone can see it.
DialogueDictionary.There's no hope. Everyone will die, and: There's no hope. Everyone will die, and it will be a vast void outside our Solar Neighborhood.
No, just give up and die.
DialogueDictionary.Well, I sent out a probe out to interste: Well, I sent out a probe out to interstellar space with all of our information on it. When we're all dead, there's no alien invasion to worry about, right?
DialogueDictionary.No I will not! What else is there to do?: No I will not! What else is there to do? Go bother someone else with that attitude!
DialogueDictionary.If you want to find it, it has a signal: If you want to find it, it has a signal on it. That is, if your kind has that technology yet.
DialogueDictionary.Oh yeah, I'm quite aware. We're all choo: Oh yeah, I'm quite aware. We're all choosing to die in peace, just ask everyone, they'll all say the same thing.
DialogueDictionary.Also, I'm working on something to make s: Also, I'm working on something to make sure we're not forgotten.
DialogueDictionary.Oh there's plenty of places to explore i: Oh there's plenty of places to explore in this star system!
DialogueDictionary.The motto for the space program is, \"Fr: The motto for the space program is, "From the crimson gale, to the burning dune, we watch the skies from our home moon".
DialogueDictionary.For starters, if you can use signal dete: For starters, if you can use signal detection technology, I'd follow the radio signals of our friends out in space right now.
DialogueDictionary.They've been dwelling on those planets f: They've been dwelling on those planets for quite a while, so they might know a thing or two.
DialogueDictionary.Your friend \"Hornfels\" does the same j: Your friend "Hornfels" does the same job I do, huh? We may do the same job, but somehow I doubt we're alike at all.
Okay then, feel free to explore space.
DialogueDictionary.This music sucks! It's all the same thin: This music sucks! It's all the same thing every day! Don't you agree!
No, this is actually pretty soothing.
DialogueDictionary.Trust me, you'll grow tired of it after: Trust me, you'll grow tired of it after you've heard it so many times like I have...
DialogueDictionary.So soothing. I could just sit here for h: So soothing. I could just sit here for hours...
Your star is going to die by the way.
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 1: Yearly checkup on all the: OBSERVATION 1: Yearly checkup on all the planets! Everything's OK, the desert's still deadly on its sun-facing side, the crimson stormy planet is still brewing, and the fourth continues to act mysteriously, changing its form each view.
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 2: The strange base on the v: OBSERVATION 2: The strange base on the volcanic moon shows itself yet again. Why are these buildings there? Could they be from the old space program all those years ago?
DialogueDictionary.OBSERVATION 3: The universe is about to: OBSERVATION 3: The universe is about to die. Our neighbor star where our ancestors' old ship lies, it will die 11 minutes before our star dies. We have plenty of time to leave, but we don't want to leave home. We'd rather die with it, unlike our ancestors did.
DialogueDictionary.This statue is dedicated to our almighty: This statue is dedicated to our almighty Scientist, who never gave up on his dream of home. Without him, we would not regain our home and our species would cease to exist!
DialogueDictionary.To the Founding of the New Space Program: To the Founding of the New Space Program!
DialogueDictionary.Arcadia: Bring forth courage, never fear: Arcadia: Bring forth courage, never fear.
DialogueDictionary.Bush: There's plenty of things to see an: Bush: There's plenty of things to see and hear.
DialogueDictionary.Pine: Blow fury away with all your breat: Pine: Blow fury away with all your breath.
DialogueDictionary.Bark: For caution will guide you away fr: Bark: For caution will guide you away from death.
DialogueDictionary.Twig: Returning after all these years, m: Twig: Returning after all these years, marching forward, despite our fears.
DialogueDictionary.The history and mysteries of the cosmos: The history and mysteries of the cosmos awaits us.
DialogueDictionary.This quirky rock from the farthest plane: This quirky rock from the farthest planet seems to change position whenever it isn't being observed.
DialogueDictionary.Day 63: Finally, everything from the thr: Day 63: Finally, everything from the three archives and the cloaked moon transferred. My work here on the ship is done.
DialogueDictionary.REMEMBER TO TAKE YOUR SLIDES AND YOUR AR: REMEMBER TO TAKE YOUR SLIDES AND YOUR ARTIFACT WITH YOU ON THE ELEVATOR BY SETTING THEM ON THE ELEVATOR FLOOR.
DialogueDictionary.What an incredible species you are, and: What an incredible species you are, and what an incredible language you speak. Am I speaking your language right and do you understand me clearly?
DialogueDictionary.Could you speak up a little more?: Could you speak up a little more?
DialogueDictionary.Aren't you going to snap my neck?: Aren't you going to snap my neck?
DialogueDictionary.*AHEM* I can't talk that loudly without: *AHEM* I can't talk that loudly without messing up my throat, so you're going to just have to listen closely...
DialogueDictionary.I'm not violent like the others, nor do: I'm not violent like the others, nor do I wish to prevent people from accessing archives like my kind is doing in this simulation. I do not wish to hurt you, but I do wish to learn from you.
DialogueDictionary.I can see you have a lot of questions fo: I can see you have a lot of questions for me. Tell me, what’s on your mind?
DialogueDictionary.How are you in here? I see you don't hav: How are you in here? I see you don't have an artifact.
DialogueDictionary.What was your kind like before they foun: What was your kind like before they found the Eye of the Universe?
DialogueDictionary.Do you know the Prisoner? What were they: Do you know the Prisoner? What were they like before the Eye of the Universe?
Tell me more about life on the Stranger.
DialogueDictionary.You said you are a scientist, is that co: You said you are a scientist, is that correct? What do you study?
DialogueDictionary.So you talk about a leader a lot. What i: So you talk about a leader a lot. What is your system of government?
Tell me more about Angler's Eye.
DialogueDictionary.Why do you like to write so much instead: Why do you like to write so much instead of making slide reels?
DialogueDictionary.Actually, I want to share my experiences: Actually, I want to share my experiences with you instead.
DialogueDictionary.Do you have any more questions for me?: Do you have any more questions for me?
DialogueDictionary.You said you are a scientist is that cor: You said you are a scientist is that correct? What do you study?
DialogueDictionary.What are the origins of the Angler's Eye: What are the origins of the Angler's Eye?
DialogueDictionary.Unlike the rest here, my mind was upload: Unlike the rest here, my mind was uploaded. Therefore, I did not sleep to enter.
DialogueDictionary.I got uploaded before I left our ship to: I got uploaded before I left our ship to resume studying. I don't know whether I succeeded with the terraform, died on the way, stranded on that cloaked moon, or just plain failed.
DialogueDictionary.Although I may be just blocks of code, I: Although I may be just blocks of code, I'm still as alive as the "real" me once was.
DialogueDictionary.I have never been too fond of my real na: I have never been too fond of my real name so if you must please call me "the Scientist".
DialogueDictionary.Before I left our ship, I was the head o: Before I left our ship, I was the head of the scientific committee. I was the first one to utilize green fire and invented the vision torch.
DialogueDictionary.I was however blindsighted by my leader': I was however blindsighted by my leader's... ulterior motives. I was directly involved in the technology needed to directly build the ship.
DialogueDictionary.I didn't want to tear down our home plan: I didn't want to tear down our home planet, but it was his orders. He made me build that ship regardless of how unhealthy conditions were.
DialogueDictionary.When I left, I put my assistant in charg: When I left, I put my assistant in charge because I could not deal with the shame I felt. The committee thought I died in the crash, and didn't bother checking.
DialogueDictionary.And then, the simulation, this fake delu: And then, the simulation, this fake delusion we are all trapped in was built. I would never have approved of this prison.
DialogueDictionary.All just another futile attempt to fix a: All just another futile attempt to fix a mistake I warned them about.
DialogueDictionary.Ah yes, my family. There were four of us: Ah yes, my family. There were four of us. Me, my wife, my son, and my infant daughter.
DialogueDictionary.Our youngest was born on the ship, but d: Our youngest was born on the ship, but due to lack of nutrients and poor atmosphere, she passed away only a week later.
DialogueDictionary.We decided that the ship was no longer s: We decided that the ship was no longer safe for us, so we had to give terraforming a shot.
DialogueDictionary.We landed on the cloaked moon, far from: We landed on the cloaked moon, far from our ship, but like a disease, it followed. Our son also didn't make it.
DialogueDictionary.We decided then and there that the only: We decided then and there that the only hope for us was to resurrect the husk of our old home; our home moon.
DialogueDictionary.My kind had a deep connection with natur: My kind had a deep connection with nature, so we tried to take it with us on our voyage.
DialogueDictionary.Before we found that vortex in the sky,: Before we found that vortex in the sky, which you have called the "Eye of the Universe", we lived very simple and pleasant lives.
DialogueDictionary.We lived peacefully under the Ringed Gia: We lived peacefully under the Ringed Giant, rafting its rivers, counting the stars, enjoying the simple pleasures of life.
DialogueDictionary.Some of us had hobbies; building furnitu: Some of us had hobbies; building furniture, playing board games, music, and even fishing.
DialogueDictionary.Most of my kind was very spiritual, some: Most of my kind was very spiritual, some even worshipping idols and making sacrifices to ancient, now long forgotten gods.
DialogueDictionary.I was one of the few individuals who did: I was one of the few individuals who didn't care for worship, in fact my whole family was that way.
DialogueDictionary.It was only natural for my kind to sacri: It was only natural for my kind to sacrifice the planet to reach the "Eye of the Universe". After all that, we were never the same. No more gods, no more faith.
DialogueDictionary.The one locked down underground? We once: The one locked down underground? We once knew each other but we had a... falling out. I don't like talking about it.
DialogueDictionary.The time on the Stranger really made him: The time on the Stranger really made him go insane! He became so hopeless about losing home that he deactivated the Signal Blocker.
DialogueDictionary.When he scanned The Eye... what he saw d: When he scanned The Eye... what he saw drove him to obsession. He thought it would end our suffering and reset the universe.
DialogueDictionary.The problem is, there's probably many ot: The problem is, there's probably many other lifeforms out there. Why must we end their lives because we suffered? It is simply not yet time to activate The Vortex.
DialogueDictionary.However, despite his obsessions, I do wi: However, despite his obsessions, I do wish for the times we had before.
DialogueDictionary.Anyway let’s change the topic before I s: Anyway let’s change the topic before I start getting all emotional.
DialogueDictionary.This \"Stranger\" you speak of, do you m: This "Stranger" you speak of, do you mean our ship? That wretched place was awful.
DialogueDictionary.We started our voyage with 55 crew membe: We started our voyage with 55 crew members. Many others were lost, including a popular singer.
DialogueDictionary.When we arrived, 20 died excluding my wi: When we arrived, 20 died excluding my wife and I, while the other 33 remain trapped here in this simulation.
DialogueDictionary.We made a memorial at the bottom of a we: We made a memorial at the bottom of a well, but we don't like to remember those painful memories.
DialogueDictionary.The death wasn’t the only toll it took o: The death wasn’t the only toll it took on us. No animals lived till the ship was built and the trip was expected to take way less time than it did so by the time we arrived we barely had any food left.
DialogueDictionary.All those factors meant children could n: All those factors meant children could not grow. My two beautiful children died due to the incompetence of our leader.
DialogueDictionary.He knew we didn’t have the technology to: He knew we didn’t have the technology to do this the ability to play god like we did.
DialogueDictionary.Plenty of my kind have even taken their: Plenty of my kind have even taken their own lives due to this madness or starved to death due to lack of food. All while our leader said it was a "necessary sacrifice".
DialogueDictionary.When I came back, I was even more horrif: When I came back, I was even more horrified to see what happened next. I saw all the burned reels, the burnt codes, and all my dead friends lying dead around an eerie, green fire.
DialogueDictionary.I then discovered this digital prison, a: I then discovered this digital prison, and was disturbed to see my friends here......alive...
DialogueDictionary.So I coded in this whole area, and added: So I coded in this whole area, and added an archive and a coma hall to ease the pains of the others, trapped here in this simulation for eternity.
DialogueDictionary.If only I was able to put a stop to it a: If only I was able to put a stop to it all...
DialogueDictionary.I specify in the green fire technology t: I specify in the green fire technology that you see all around us, but we have always been more spiritual than scientific.
DialogueDictionary.Before the green fire technology, our ki: Before the green fire technology, our kind didn't have much at all. We were basically primitive.
DialogueDictionary.And when we did discover green fire, our: And when we did discover green fire, our kind used them as an early way to communicate basic ideas though raw fire is very fuzzy.
DialogueDictionary.But then one day, my father discovered h: But then one day, my father discovered how to focus and use it effectively.
DialogueDictionary.And years later, I invented the Vision T: And years later, I invented the Vision Torch, which then lead to the development of computers, telescopes, and this vision torch you see before you.
DialogueDictionary.A colleage of mine also discovered some: A colleage of mine also discovered some crystals which give off electricity when lit up. A decade and some trial and error later we have the light sensors.
DialogueDictionary.Our ship's cloak is all natural resource: Our ship's cloak is all natural resources we've mined from the cloaked moon. We didn't really have to configure it at all.
DialogueDictionary.Well, we can actually have up to 11 lead: Well, we can actually have up to 11 leaders, but almost always, one leader is more powerful than the rest.
DialogueDictionary.Our most powerful leader usually wears y: Our most powerful leader usually wears yellow clothing, but his advisors who we deem "The Council" typically dress in red.
DialogueDictionary.Our hierarchy system was directly relate: Our hierarchy system was directly related to the color of clothing. It goes from top to bottom: yellow, red, blue, green, gray, brown and rugged. The wealthy often had jewelry.
DialogueDictionary.However, our leader was a tyrant since w: However, our leader was a tyrant since we found that vortex. He doesn't listen to his advisors and may even imprison those who defy him.
DialogueDictionary.Those who refused to board the ship to r: Those who refused to board the ship to reach the vortex were left home to starve, including one of our famous singers. Leaving home was truly a terrifying day.
DialogueDictionary.If only I had the spinal column to warn: If only I had the spinal column to warn him about building the ship. Maybe we wouldn’t be here now.
DialogueDictionary.Angler's Eye? If you're talking about th: Angler's Eye? If you're talking about the cloaked moon, then I like what you named it.
DialogueDictionary.When we discovered what the vortex would: When we discovered what the vortex would do to our universe, we went there to mine out minerals for our ship's cloak.
DialogueDictionary.We found it when we were scanning the ot: We found it when we were scanning the other planets in your system, but we predicted the trajectory incorrectly.
DialogueDictionary.For the terraforming plan, I was told by: For the terraforming plan, I was told by the Council to check to see if our homeworld was able to be terraformed, but we ended up crashing into the cloaked moon on our way there.
DialogueDictionary.The crash happened due to our false assu: The crash happened due to our false assumptions about its orbit.
DialogueDictionary.As my time on the cloaked moon went on,: As my time on the cloaked moon went on, I found out that it was an "evil twin" of the ghost moon. Instead of copying just the terrain, some of the properties from the planet get imbued into it.
DialogueDictionary.I've also noticed that when you hold one: I've also noticed that when you hold one of the minerals of the planet when going into the hurricane, it will not harm you.
DialogueDictionary.Unlike most of my kind I've never been a: Unlike most of my kind I've never been all too great at art. Never my skill set. I always like something more... tangible. Also slide reels are kind of clunky, too.
DialogueDictionary.A bit rude but sure, what happened after: A bit rude but sure, what happened after we entered this eternal sleep?
DialogueDictionary.So first there were this species called: So first there were this species called The Nomai...
DialogueDictionary.That icy planet Angler's Eye orbited? It: That icy planet Angler's Eye orbited? It's now Dark Bramble.
DialogueDictionary.I've managed to make it into the hurrica: I've managed to make it into the hurricane on Angler's Eye.
DialogueDictionary.Never mind, I actually have some questio: Never mind, I actually have some questions.
Never mind, I don't want to talk at all.
DialogueDictionary.Anything else you know that you can shar: Anything else you know that you can share?
DialogueDictionary.Is Dark Bramble what you call the last s: Is Dark Bramble what you call the last stage of the infection? It seems fitting.
DialogueDictionary.They were about my height, had fur, and: They were about my height, had fur, and 3 eyes.
DialogueDictionary.Fur? How strange. What can you tell me a: Fur? How strange. What can you tell me about them?
I can tell you where they came from.
I can tell you what they did.
I can tell you how they died.
They wrote everywhere just like you.
DialogueDictionary.Wow, how did it get here?: Wow, how did it get here?
DialogueDictionary.They got a signal from the Eye of the Un: They got a signal from the Eye of the Universe.
DialogueDictionary.Really? I thought we silenced that bomb!: Really? I thought we silenced that bomb!
DialogueDictionary.You did, but they got the signal from th: You did, but they got the signal from the moment the Prisoner let it free.
I am unsure about how they got it too.
DialogueDictionary.Ah... that fool... So, what happened to: Ah... that fool... So, what happened to them? Seeing as you are here, they seem to have not found it.
DialogueDictionary.Their leader, Escall was too hasty in hi: Their leader, Escall was too hasty in his decision to warp and never let anyone know where he was going. They crashed in Dark Bramble which grew significantly since you last saw it.
DialogueDictionary.I am unsure of the details. All I know i: I am unsure of the details. All I know is they came from 2 Escape Pods on Brittle Hollow and Ember Twin.
DialogueDictionary.Ah a shame. Let me know if you do. So, w: Ah a shame. Let me know if you do. So, what happened to them? Seeing as you are here, they seem to have not found it.
DialogueDictionary.Is Dark Bramble what you call the last s: Is Dark Bramble what you call the last stage of the infection? It seems fitting. How did they escape from it? I predicted it would have been quite hard to navigate.
DialogueDictionary.Three of the Escape Pods tried to escape: Three of the Escape Pods tried to escape but only two of them got out. They crashed on Brittle Hollow and Ember Twin.
DialogueDictionary.What a shame. Let me know if you find an: What a shame. Let me know if you find anything else.
DialogueDictionary.Ah sorry to hear about that. What else c: Ah sorry to hear about that. What else can you say about these Nomai?
I can tell how they died.
DialogueDictionary.Do you have any more information on the: Do you have any more information on the Nomai?
DialogueDictionary.Yes do tell me, what did they do when th: Yes do tell me, what did they do when they arrived here?
DialogueDictionary.The Nomai crash landed here in pursuit o: The Nomai crash landed here in pursuit of the Eye of the Universe and tried to find it. Because it wasn’t calling out anymore, they needed to make a new device to find it.
Ah so many fools looking for that bomb. So, what did they do? Fly out in space looking for it?
DialogueDictionary.They decided to make this huge project t: They decided to make this huge project they called the Ash Twin Project.
DialogueDictionary.I don't know what their plan was to find: I don't know what their plan was to find it.
DialogueDictionary.The Nomai discovered a black hole pair w: The Nomai discovered a black hole pair with energy put into it would make it possible to go back in time but only sending information was deemed paradox free. They would send a probe out in a random direction and if it didn't find it, they would blow up the sun to make enough power to go back in time by 22 minutes.
DialogueDictionary.I don't understand any of the inner work: I don't understand any of the inner workings, all I know is it involves time loops.
DialogueDictionary.Blowing up the sun? That sounds a little: Blowing up the sun? That sounds a little extreme.
DialogueDictionary.Most Nomai agreed with you, but they wen: Most Nomai agreed with you, but they went through with it regardless. The Sun Station was made to blow up the sun but ultimately failed.
DialogueDictionary.Time loops? That sounds incredibly inter: Time loops? That sounds incredibly interesting. Let me know more when you find it.
DialogueDictionary.Ah well good thing for that seeing as yo: Ah well good thing for that seeing as you would be dead if it didn't. So, what else can you tell me about Nomai?
DialogueDictionary.Really? What was their writing system li: Really? What was their writing system like?
DialogueDictionary.They wrote in spirals with branching pat: They wrote in spirals with branching paths that other Nomai would add to.
DialogueDictionary.I see! While we write in very different: I see! While we write in very different ways, we seem to be fond of that.
DialogueDictionary.Why do you prefer to write instead of ma: Why do you prefer to write instead of making slide reels?
DialogueDictionary.Well then, how did they die?: Well then, how did they die?
DialogueDictionary.To a comet we've named \"The Interloper\: To a comet we've named "The Interloper", which contained a deadly, cold, and burning substance we called "Ghost Matter".
DialogueDictionary.Ghost Matter? The way you describe it so: Ghost Matter? The way you describe it sounds similar to the elements I used to make the Vision Torch. I doubt it was sent by us or anyone on purpose, but I hypothesize that the comet is where the element can naturally be found.
DialogueDictionary.Same elements? Our universe is truly an: Same elements? Our universe is truly an interesting place.
DialogueDictionary.Unlike most of my kind, I've never been: Unlike most of my kind, I've never been all too great at art. Never my skill set. So, what else can you tell me about Nomai?
DialogueDictionary.Well if you find out anything else, let: Well if you find out anything else, let me know! I'm dying for more.
DialogueDictionary.You must be talking about the one locked: You must be talking about the one locked up below the lake. What was he like?
DialogueDictionary.He shared to me why he got imprisoned in: He shared to me why he got imprisoned in the vault. After experiencing some kind of emotional catharsis. Once free he decided to extinguish his flame, free from the burden that it wasn't all in vain.
DialogueDictionary.Well, he's probably glad he doesn't have: Well, he's probably glad he doesn't have to suffer anymore. Let’s move on from this topic please. He always brings up bad memories for me.
DialogueDictionary.I hope I was helping you. Tell me, what: I hope I was helping you. Tell me, what did I do in there?
DialogueDictionary.You planted a Bramble seed to try and ge: You planted a Bramble seed to try and get home, and I made it inside. You built a base inside one of the dimensions.
You planted a Bramble seed to try and get home, and I made it inside. It's quite dark in there!
DialogueDictionary.A base, huh? Good to know I made it that: A base, huh? Good to know I made it that far into my plan.
DialogueDictionary.No, there's some Anglerfish in there wit: No, there's some Anglerfish in there with lights.
DialogueDictionary.If I were you, I would have tried to fin: If I were you, I would have tried to find some sort of guidance. Listen for signals or use the Anglerfish lights, but don't get close to them!
DialogueDictionary.But that's interesting I was able to uti: But that's interesting I was able to utilize a Bramble Seed to try and travel back home to terraform it.
DialogueDictionary.It worked? I can just imagine the beauty: It worked? I can just imagine the beauty of our terraformed home! Is our species still around after those hundreds of thousands of years?
DialogueDictionary.By some miracle, yes! I even met your de: By some miracle, yes! I even met your descendant!
DialogueDictionary.That's wonderful! I wish I could meet hi: That's wonderful! I wish I could meet him, but I can't leave this place.
DialogueDictionary.Your descendants killed some Nomai becau: Your descendants killed some Nomai because you thought they were a threat to your home.
DialogueDictionary.I can bring him home to see you through: I can bring him home to see you through a Nomai Vessel.
DialogueDictionary.I can try, but I don’t think my ship has: I can try, but I don’t think my ship has the power to do it.
DialogueDictionary.Oh my I am so sorry for their actions. I: Oh my I am so sorry for their actions. If I were there, I would never have authorized such a plan. Or at least I wouldn’t. Who knows what I went through during the redevelopment...
DialogueDictionary.Really? That'd mean the world to me!: Really? That'd mean the world to me!
DialogueDictionary.It was nice meeting you. Good luck to yo: It was nice meeting you. Good luck to you and your species on your space endeavors.
DialogueDictionary.Elevator to Bottom Archives: Informative: Elevator to Bottom Archives: Informative Slide Reels
DialogueDictionary.Elevator to Top Archives: Historical Sli: Elevator to Top Archives: Historical Slide Reels
DialogueDictionary.They may think these archives are forbid: They may think these archives are forbidden, but our history must be preserved. Although I wanted the archives to be freely accessible, our leader in his yellow clothing wanted me to attach it to the back of the coma house so that it could be guarded. No big loss, as long as they're preserved.
DialogueDictionary.It doesn't matter what they do in this s: It doesn't matter what they do in this simulation, they will never forget what happened, they will always feel guilty for their past, and things will never be the same. Why suffer with these feelings for all eternity? So I built a place where they can stay in "sleep mode" forever, their code disabled for as long as they wish. Once it was finished, most of the clan, even our leader came over to achieve a coma-like state! I did what I could do to set things right in this simulation, but I must remember, I am still of my kind.
DialogueDictionary.Day 53: I arrived at my kin's ship yeste: Day 53: I arrived at my kin's ship yesterday, and everyone here is dead. All they left behind is this simulation of our home moon, in which I have coded this new area. Had they listened to me before, this wouldn't have happened.
DialogueDictionary.Day 53: I just ran into a few of my frie: Day 53: I just ran into a few of my friends, and surprisingly, they're still alive here! This simulation must preserve an organism after it dies! I...I don't know how to feel about this...
DialogueDictionary.Day 54: There's nothing I can do to help: Day 54: There's nothing I can do to help my kin. So many of them know that life in the simulation is not the same as life in our moon, but it's too late for them to terraform it with me now.
DialogueDictionary.This memorial is in place in honor of my: This memorial is in place in honor of my family. My two children have passed due to lack of nutrients on my kin's ship. And in case my wife and I die, I put a memorial in place for her and myself as well.
DialogueDictionary.Some idiot tried to steal some of my sli: Some idiot tried to steal some of my slide reels to try and burn them, but I managed to get them back from him. He ran off to the left when you walk out the door.
DialogueDictionary.Day 53: I spoke with some of the remaini: Day 53: I spoke with some of the remaining scientists in the simulation about the solar sails today. Seems like activation may affect the power and the simulation too. With the changes I made, it will hopefully stabilize about 6 minutes later.
Surfing really brings me at peace...
DialogueDictionary.Is there anything else to explore here?: Is there anything else to explore here?
DialogueDictionary.Do you know anything about this planet's: Do you know anything about this planet's moon?
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Gabbro who's: You remind me of my friend Gabbro who's always calm and zen.
DialogueDictionary.You going to get off my raft yet?: You going to get off my raft yet?
DialogueDictionary.There's quite a few things actually, oth: There's quite a few things actually, other than myself.
DialogueDictionary.The water here's not safe to swim in, be: The water here's not safe to swim in, because it can shock you.
DialogueDictionary.There's the tornadoes, which throw small: There's the tornadoes, which throw small objects in the air. The ones going clockwise are safe, but the counter-clockwise one will send you to a painful death.
Aside from the dangers, there's my camp. There are two bases, one of which is next to my camp. I've never bothered to check either of them, though.
DialogueDictionary.That crazy inferno? Never been, although: That crazy inferno? Never been, although I did hear there was another old base up there...
DialogueDictionary.I found the base! It was full-blown mili: I found the base! It was full-blown military base with bombs.
DialogueDictionary.A military base? Bombs? This must be why: A military base? Bombs? This must be why our program was shut down for millenia.
DialogueDictionary.I'm nothing like your friend Gabbro. I'm: I'm nothing like your friend Gabbro. I'm always so anxious, furious, and squirmy, so I have to take all my anger out by doing this.
DialogueDictionary.Plus you're not trapped in a time loop w: Plus you're not trapped in a time loop with me....
DialogueDictionary.Time loop? What kind of nonsense are you: Time loop? What kind of nonsense are you talking about?
DialogueDictionary.Next time, don't bother me on my raft! I: Next time, don't bother me on my raft! I'm already mad about our star dying soon!
DialogueDictionary.Hey, on the bright side, that crash wasn: Hey, on the bright side, that crash wasn't cool enough...
DialogueDictionary.The atmosphere of this planet will be st: The atmosphere of this planet will be stripped off in just 23 minutes!
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Feldspar who: You remind me of my friend Feldspar who can take on anything.
DialogueDictionary.Anything else you want to tell me?: Anything else you want to tell me?
DialogueDictionary.I don't know, this place is pretty borin: I don't know, this place is pretty boring, there's not even an old lab like the other planets have.
DialogueDictionary.Oh yeah, anything past that equator is f: Oh yeah, anything past that equator is fatal! You will burn to death on the sun-facing side!
DialogueDictionary.How can I get over to the sun-facing sid: How can I get over to the sun-facing side without dying?
DialogueDictionary.Are you serious? There is no way over th: Are you serious? There is no way over there! Besides, there's nothing over there! What could you possibly want there?
DialogueDictionary.I don't know, but I want to explore ther: I don't know, but I want to explore there badly!
DialogueDictionary.Well if you go down there and die, don't: Well if you go down there and die, don't say I didn't warn you!
DialogueDictionary.Alright, alright! I get it! You're scare: Alright, alright! I get it! You're scared!
DialogueDictionary.Wh-wh-WHAT???? I gotta get out of here b: Wh-wh-WHAT???? I gotta get out of here but my ship's not intact!
Come with me in my ship.
DialogueDictionary.That grimey old thing strapped together: That grimey old thing strapped together in duct tape? Absolutely not! And how should I trust you?
DialogueDictionary.I wish that was true because I am SCARED: I wish that was true because I am SCARED TO DEATH right now.
DialogueDictionary.I am afraid of literally everything you: I am afraid of literally everything you can think of!
DialogueDictionary.Then what are you doing in space?: Then what are you doing in space?
DialogueDictionary.Then why did you say the ship crash wasn: Then why did you say the ship crash wasn't cool enough? That's a classic Feldspar line!
DialogueDictionary.I-I-I don't know! I'm afraid of large gr: I-I-I don't know! I'm afraid of large groups, so I just...took off and left.
DialogueDictionary.I want to be alone, but this place still: I want to be alone, but this place still gives me the creeps!
DialogueDictionary.OK, don't let me find you dead on the eq: OK, don't let me find you dead on the equator!
DialogueDictionary.This \"Feldspar\" you speak of actually: This "Feldspar" you speak of actually says that all the time? Haha! That's quite a coincidence.
DialogueDictionary.Honestly, I just said that as a coping m: Honestly, I just said that as a coping mechanism, despite those never work for me.
DialogueDictionary.Do you need me to take you home?: Do you need me to take you home?
DialogueDictionary.Do you know anything about this planet?: Do you know anything about this planet?
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Chert who was: You remind me of my friend Chert who was afraid of our star dying.
DialogueDictionary.Do you know how to find the scratch?: Do you know how to find the scratch?
DialogueDictionary.Do you know how to find the crack?: Do you know how to find the crack?
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Solanum, who: You remind me of my friend Solanum, who was trapped on a quantum body like this.
DialogueDictionary.Th-th-three states. I am one of th-third: Th-th-three states. I am one of th-third. All three c-c-connected.
DialogueDictionary.Sol-solanum? N-not like S-s-solanum eith: Sol-solanum? N-not like S-s-solanum either...I c-c-can leave if I want, b-b-but I'm f-f-frozen so it's hard to m-move.
DialogueDictionary.B-b-b-by my ship! Near the Lab, C-c-cold: B-b-b-by my ship! Near the Lab, C-c-cold!
DialogueDictionary.Brrr! Ab-b-bout 120 m-m-m-meters s-s-s-s: Brrr! Ab-b-bout 120 m-m-m-meters s-s-s-south of the lab! It's s-s-sitting by a lantern, C-c-cold!
DialogueDictionary.Ch-ch-Chert? Do n-n-not fear s-s-star de: Ch-ch-Chert? Do n-n-not fear s-s-star death, b-but can't move. I'm not Ch-chert.
DialogueDictionary.Do you know what it does?: Do you know what it does?
DialogueDictionary.You remind me of my friend Riebeck who l: You remind me of my friend Riebeck who loves ancient architecture.
DialogueDictionary.Not much on or below the surface, no. I: Not much on or below the surface, no. I do have a camp south of here, but it's just a tent, some things i found, and a campfire.
DialogueDictionary.There is however a space station floatin: There is however a space station floating just above the planet. Since our home got terraformed, it's just been abandoned.
DialogueDictionary.I've been there, that's where I came fro: I've been there, that's where I came from.
DialogueDictionary.You have? What was in there? How did you: You have? What was in there? How did you get in? i thought the place was sealed off!
DialogueDictionary.I went through a few of those treacherou: I went through a few of those treacherous Bramble Dimensions after discovering it in my home system.
DialogueDictionary.Hmmm...so the only way in is to go throu: Hmmm...so the only way in is to go through those "Bramble Dimensions" you say?
DialogueDictionary.Yes, and watch out for Quantum Anglerfis: Yes, and watch out for Quantum Anglerfish!
DialogueDictionary.Alright. I'll give it a shot! I fear no: Alright. I'll give it a shot! I fear no fish!
DialogueDictionary.I do not, and you can probably tell by m: I do not, and you can probably tell by my curiosity. I've never seen anything like this before, but it looks like something our ancestors built.
DialogueDictionary.What's your theory on this place?: What's your theory on this place?
DialogueDictionary.The only thing I can make of it, is that: The only thing I can make of it, is that it's some sort of machine with sockets. The symbols on them might be where to find them...
I'll let you know if I find anything.
DialogueDictionary.I found the seal! It was right by your c: I found the seal! It was right by your camp.
DialogueDictionary.So THAT'S what that thing was...I found: So THAT'S what that thing was...I found that thing the other day, but when I found this structure today, I completely forgot about that slab you found.
DialogueDictionary.And a hologram symbol shows up when I in: And a hologram symbol shows up when I insert it.
DialogueDictionary.I have no idea what it could mean. We us: I have no idea what it could mean. We use those symbols for a lot of things. Maybe it'll be clearer if you find the rest.
DialogueDictionary.Me? Pfft, no I don't care about architec: Me? Pfft, no I don't care about architecture. Actually, at home I'm known as my kind's demolition expert.
DialogueDictionary.You sound fascinated with the structure: You sound fascinated with the structure in front of you...
DialogueDictionary.I think your star will beat you to that: I think your star will beat you to that soon...
DialogueDictionary.Sure, but not because I am fascinated wi: Sure, but not because I am fascinated with architecture, but because you don't see this every day.
DialogueDictionary.To be fair, wouldn't this make just anyo: To be fair, wouldn't this make just anyone's brain start ticking?
DialogueDictionary.Well little guy, let me know if you figu: Well little guy, let me know if you figure anything out.
DialogueDictionary.Oh yeah? Well I know and I don't care!: Oh yeah? Well I know and I don't care!
DialogueDictionary.Is this The Vortex? It sure doesn't look: Is this The Vortex? It sure doesn't look like what I was told.
DialogueDictionary.How is that possible? He's been long gon: How is that possible? He's been long gone!
DialogueDictionary.Well, if you say so. I'll let you lead t: Well, if you say so. I'll let you lead the way.
DialogueDictionary.Oh hey, Hatchling! I'm just catching my: Oh hey, Hatchling! I'm just catching my Greatest Granddad up to date with everyting!
DialogueDictionary.The Terraform Plan, The Aliens, The War,: The Terraform Plan, The Aliens, The War, Me, You...all the works.
DialogueDictionary.He's told me about his family and what l: He's told me about his family and what life was like before and during the days we were aboard this ship.
DialogueDictionary.It's crazy how rich our kind's history h: It's crazy how rich our kind's history has become, and now I've been face-to-face with a peaceful alien!
DialogueDictionary.The Universe is about to blow, so it's a: The Universe is about to blow, so it's a shame no one will get to read the history books up to this point.
DialogueDictionary.But I'm still overly grateful to meet TH: But I'm still overly grateful to meet THE Scientist, my distant grandfather.
DialogueDictionary.Thank you, friend. You've made my dreams: Thank you, friend. You've made my dreams a reality.
DialogueDictionary.Say, is there anyone else here you want: Say, is there anyone else here you want me to meet?
DialogueDictionary.Greatest Grandpa, I don't understand why: Greatest Grandpa, I don't understand why you don't like that name. It's way cooler than mine!
DialogueDictionary.Cypress is pretty boring, it's just a ty: Cypress is pretty boring, it's just a type of tree that's abundant on our home moon.
DialogueDictionary.And it's a name that's been given to so: And it's a name that's been given to so many leaders before me. Even other boring names like Pine and Bush sound cooler compared to mine.
DialogueDictionary.I was born into a privileged lineage, ex: I was born into a privileged lineage, expected to lead and protect our homeland. It was a daunting responsibility.
DialogueDictionary.It's crazy. I can't even imagine what a: It's crazy. I can't even imagine what a normal life is like!
DialogueDictionary.Distant Uncle, I forgive you. Without yo: Distant Uncle, I forgive you. Without your risky actions, we would not be here today.
DialogueDictionary.I don't even want to imagine the pain an: I don't even want to imagine the pain and insanity you had to go through.
DialogueDictionary.It's no wonder you did what you did, you: It's no wonder you did what you did, you wanted it all to end.
DialogueDictionary.It's wonderful to meet all of you. I'm g: It's wonderful to meet all of you. I'm grateful to be apart of this wonderful family.
And Hatchling, once again, I thank you. For everything. As for everyone else.
DialogueDictionary.Hatchling, once again, I thank you. For: Hatchling, once again, I thank you. For everything.
DialogueDictionary.Hey it's me Ernesto, the magic talking a: Hey it's me Ernesto, the magic talking anglerfish.
DialogueDictionary.Now this isn't the time for fun and game: Now this isn't the time for fun and games, OK? I have something very important to tell you.
DialogueDictionary.Some ominous creature in a trench coat t: Some ominous creature in a trench coat that dubbed itself as "Anonymous" came up to me, and it wanted me to pass on a warning.
DialogueDictionary.And the warning? It goes a little someth: And the warning? It goes a little something like this.
DialogueDictionary.<size=72>DO NOT SHOOT YOUR SCOUT INTO TH: <size=72>DO NOT SHOOT YOUR SCOUT INTO THE EYE</size>
DialogueDictionary.Yeah, a certain section has an elevator: Yeah, a certain section has an elevator and an instrument that both don't work unless you launch your scout once when you find it.
DialogueDictionary.I know it's tempting, but you can just l: I know it's tempting, but you can just launch your scout right before you jump into the orb. Got it?
DialogueDictionary.Don't screw this up, or you'll have to r: Don't screw this up, or you'll have to restart the mod!
There's someone I'd like you to meet.
DialogueDictionary.How do you understand my language?: How do you understand my language?
DialogueDictionary.He didn't like his name much, sounded to: He didn't like his name much, sounded too much like "xylophone".
DialogueDictionary.Mother named him Xylo because it meant \: Mother named him Xylo because it meant "wood". It fits, because he was hearty, strong, and determined. Like a bundle of wood.
DialogueDictionary.Then came me, the younger brother, Phyll: Then came me, the younger brother, Phyllo. Meaning "leaf", they named me that because I was soft, but had a big heart.
DialogueDictionary.When I found out he crashed on that plan: When I found out he crashed on that planet, I was devastated. I was lost without him.
DialogueDictionary.And now here I am, locked up for eternit: And now here I am, locked up for eternity hoping the atoms of our terror turned into a bustling, new universe.
DialogueDictionary.Say, there's someone you want me to meet: Say, there's someone you want me to meet?
I'm an uncle again? Did Xylo....
DialogueDictionary.If only I could see our home again...*sn: If only I could see our home again...*sniff*
DialogueDictionary.Alright, blue friend. Lead the way!: Alright, blue friend. Lead the way!
DialogueDictionary.I'm glad Xylo left a clone of himself he: I'm glad Xylo left a clone of himself here. He may not be the same, but he's close enough!
DialogueDictionary.Hearing our home being terraformed succe: Hearing our home being terraformed successfully is way too good to be true, but it is!
DialogueDictionary.After all, I'm standing in front of my d: After all, I'm standing in front of my distant nephew. His horns, his clothing, nothing like the others on this ship.
DialogueDictionary.Ever since you left our ship that day Xy: Ever since you left our ship that day Xylo, I deeply regretted not going with you. I was way too focused on that vortex.
DialogueDictionary.And what has that vortex given me? Etern: And what has that vortex given me? Eternal suffering in that prison. I should have listened, Xylo. It was too early to let that signal go.
DialogueDictionary.But then again, that signal brought us a: But then again, that signal brought us all here. I never even dared to think anyone would hear that signal.
DialogueDictionary.Thanks to you, blue friend, I am freed a: Thanks to you, blue friend, I am freed and reunited with my family. I could never forgive you enough.
DialogueDictionary.Thank you for reuniting me with my famil: Thank you for reuniting me with my family again. It was a pleasure meeting Cypress, and you as well.
DialogueDictionary.You have my gratitude, and I hope you fo: You have my gratitude, and I hope you forgive me for what I did.
DialogueDictionary.My plan.....I can't believe it worked! A: My plan.....I can't believe it worked! And it sounded like quite the specitcale!
DialogueDictionary.Inviting my distant grandson....that has: Inviting my distant grandson....that has to be your doing, right?
DialogueDictionary.I can see the look in your eyes, my blue: I can see the look in your eyes, my blue friend. You've seen it all.
DialogueDictionary.You've gone great strides to bring back: You've gone great strides to bring back my distant grandson. Many generations have passed and I can still see myself in him.
Thank you for bringing him to me, but...
DialogueDictionary....there's someone else I want him to me: ...there's someone else I want him to meet.
DialogueDictionary.The one locked up in that prison...my br: The one locked up in that prison...my brother.....
DialogueDictionary.My little blue friend, I still thank you: My little blue friend, I still thank you for bringing Cypress here.
But....I want him to meet my brother...
DialogueDictionary.Best of luck finding him. I know you can: Best of luck finding him. I know you can do it.
DialogueDictionary.Phyllo, I remember the day we all saw Th: Phyllo, I remember the day we all saw The Vortex for the first time.
DialogueDictionary.When they scanned it with the vision tor: When they scanned it with the vision torch, they were so frightened they couldn't look anymore.
DialogueDictionary.From that moment on, feeling took over a: From that moment on, feeling took over all thought as they rushed to burn down their temple.
DialogueDictionary.After they stormed out, you and I were t: After they stormed out, you and I were the only ones left in the hangar.
DialogueDictionary.As soon as I looked back, I saw the visi: As soon as I looked back, I saw the vision torch in your hand, scanning it for yourself.
